item.title: Data Science Engineer
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Job Description

This data science engineer has accountability as a data domain subject matter expert, building automated capabilities and data products to accelerate advanced analytics.  The data science engineer is responsible for designing and building business interpretable and performant analytics solutions.  The data science engineer builds re-usable and modular, self-service capabilities to continuously increase the capacity of the advanced analytics team. The data science engineer leverages and shares their deep knowledge of, and experience with, a wide variety of data analytics and technology topics.  The data science engineer helps others to improve their knowledge and understanding of the use of data and technology.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide data subject matter expertise
  • Responsible for understanding the systems & data environment.
  • Research, explore, and tinker with new data design ideas and related technologies.
  • Collaborate with internal/external data experts.
  • Research & leverage technical documentation to gain a holistic understanding of the data domain.
  • Support Analytics projects
  • Work with data scientists to transform business requests into value-add data products and capabilities.
  • Work closely with business teams and data scientists to collaboratively assess, understand, improve, and deliver rich data content for analysis.
  • Assist in the development the conceptual/logical data models or semantic layers with appropriate business contexts.
  • Automate, re-build, and re-imagine data processes to increase efficiencies in business processes.
  • Tactical support of data access, understanding, engineering, visualization, and decision making.
  • Elevate data and analytics skills in the business
  • Help people in the business better understand the use of data and automation, drawing on a thorough understanding of and experience with technologies for intelligent automation, data modeling, data management, etc.
  • Identifying and guiding natural data champions in the business to enhance the profitable use of data.
  • Learn salient business concepts from data champions and enable them to creatively use data technologies.

Qualifications:

  • University degree in quantitative based field (e.g. Mathematics, Physics, and Engineering).
  • Advanced experience with databases.
  • Advanced Experience in Python, SQL, Spark, C#, etc.
  • Advanced Experience in automating data pipelines and working with data transformation tools.
  • Advanced experience working with internal business contacts to develop analytical reports.
  • Experience providing data analysis to support management decisions.
  • General knowledge of data analytics theory & application.
  • Experience with analytics tools and visualization tools a plus.
  • Experience with cloud technologies and Data as a Service (DaaS) a plus.

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About Manulife

About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and our global wealth and asset management segment, Manulife Investment Management, serves individuals, institutions and retirement plan members worldwide. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2021, we had CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.3 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as \'MFC\' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under \'945\' in Hong Kong.
